channel.title: [Added] New Organisation Identifier: XI-IATI-ATTIC
channel.description:
The following addition to the [IATI Organisation identifier](http://iatistandard.org/203/codelists/IATIOrganisationIdentifier/) list has been proposed for the Association of Technicians in Information Technology and Communication (ATTIC), a non-political non-profit association in Republic of Chad. The request was [reviewed by org-id.guide](https://github.com/org-id/register/issues/319) for the most appropriate identifier, and it was concluded that no alternative organisation identifier is currently available.
**Code:** XI-IATI-ATTIC **Name:** Association of Technicians in Information Technology and Communication (ATTIC) **Description:** ATTIC aims to help develop and integrate the promotion of information and communication technologies in the development policy of the formal and non-formal sectors, to fight against food insecurity and poverty, by strengthening the means of vulnerable households, refugees, returnees and internally displaced persons, and by providing socio-professional training and integration for vulnerable groups. **URL:** Website is still in progress
If no objection is received, this XI-IATI code will be approved and added in a week.

item.title: [Added] New Organisation Identifier: XI-IATI-ATTIC
item.dc:creator: IATI-techteam
item.description:
The following addition to the IATI Organisation identifier list has been proposed for the Association of Technicians in Information Technology and Communication (ATTIC), a non-political non-profit association in Republic of Chad. The request was reviewed by org-id.guide for the most appropriate identifier, and it was concluded that no alternative organisation identifier is currently available.

Code: XI-IATI-ATTIC
Name: Association of Technicians in Information Technology and Communication (ATTIC)
Description: ATTIC aims to help develop and integrate the promotion of information and communication technologies in the development policy of the formal and non-formal sectors, to fight against food insecurity and poverty, by strengthening the means of vulnerable households, refugees, returnees and internally displaced persons, and by providing socio-professional training and integration for vulnerable groups.
URL: Website is still in progress

If no objection is received, this XI-IATI code will be approved and added in a week.
